message.content:
1. A total of 93 patients underwent spine imaging.
2. 80% of the patients were women.
3. The mean age of the patients was 53.
4. The patients were randomly assigned to undergo imaging with either a 1-T horizontal open MR scanner or a 1.5-T short-bore MR scanner.
5. The 1-T horizontal open MR scanner has a vertical magnetic field.
6. The other option for imaging was a 1.5-T short-bore MR scanner.
7. The patients were consecutive.

messages.content:
Statement: Altogether, 93 (80% women, mean age 53) consecutive patients underwent spine imaging after random assignement to a 1-T horizontal open MR scanner with a vertical magnetic field or a 1.5-T short-bore MR scanner.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
